comments.body: This sounds a lot like TangoTek's super slime mod, not a bad idea.
Copper Blocks may need to be in a circuit for them to generate a field, simply powering them would not be enough
As lodestones are immovable, if one wants to create a machine that involves magnets to move objects they will need to use copper instead
More-weathered copper blocks make worse magnetic fields
Iron may have the ability to be pushed and Netherite to be pulled, or vice versa
I would like it if you could create magnetic poles where one side attracts and the other repels, but I am not sure how it would work
As Iron (and probably Netherite) are not naturally magnetic, it would be cool if you could charge them so they are attracted to positive or negative charges
As gold is not magnetic it could be used to block magnetic fields, much like wool with sculk sensors
Moving metals within magnetic fields or moving magnetic fields may result in electricity, which would activate any redstone in the area
I wouldn't have copper coils, but instead have it so if an iron or netherite block is powered through copper it creates a stronger magnetic field
The stronger the redstone signal the stronger the magnetic field
Magnetized blocks may have the enchantment glow on them or have a faint animated texture placed over them, kind of like charged creepers
Netherite should be used for very strong magnetic fields and copper for less strong ones. It would be cool if armor was also affected (copper and netherite). And tools somehow too
Why were you typing random things @ ismajlademiiii
I want better knockbackkk

if this was added it would be horrible. In java the highest vertical knockback is 1 block. In bedrock you can keep hitting people and they keep going up. If you keep attacking the player as fast as you can, it’s possible for them to pretty much fly making it impossible to reach you becuse low ground is better then high ground. Making vertical knockback higher would mean that it’s easier to do this. When your in the air you can’t do anything,this has happend to me many times. I think to improve pvp you need to reduce knockback and maybe do what java is doing with sprint resetting in 1.8. Knockback is too strong, where in sky wars I try to run away from the edge of the island but the knockback is stronger then my running speed. This makes no sense so knockback would be nerfed. Also combos on controller are too hard too do, unless you can always keep your curser on the player at all times.
An enchantment that could go along with this could make it so your items don't burn in lava
The Anti-Despawning Enchantment could be called Anchor/Anchoring

I feel that this would make the game too easy because you won't have to make new things. This could also cause some lag because if you can't find your items they would just sit there and cause some lag.

Sparkly53 has a point. Perhaps they stay in your inventory like the Curse of Binding but you can still take them out of your inventory if you want. It would be interesting if the Curse of Binding could be altered to become the enchantment that does this
If instead this item just stays in your inventory when you die, the enchantment may remove itself. Basically, it's a one-use thing
Didi
We seeriously need it, it's been five years!
Please, Mojang, this was the funniest achievement
They already did

I understand this post has not been touched in over a year but I am hear to add onto this.

I agree, yes, with so many new blocks being added to the game a temporary item like the bundle that was announced won’t really do the trick. We need an actual inventory expansion, it has not been expanded since before even Notch left the game development team. The inventory should be expanded by 1 bar.

Instead of the backpack idea, we could have a new chestplate enchantment that would also add more reason to use a chestplate over an elytra.

This enchantment would be called expanding, it would have one level (like mending), it would increase you’re inventory space by another bar, so 2 extra bars of inventory space would be possible, 1 by default, and one with a new enchantment.

This would add more reason to use a chestplate over an elytra, since quite literally no one ever uses a chestplate instead of an elytra these days, and also would solve the inventory issue, and a new enchantment, and increase the default inventory space as well. With so many new blocks being added, and even more with the upcoming Wild update and the future archeology update, this would be a great way to give players more space for items, unlike the bundle, or backpacks, this is not just an early game solution, you have the default extra inventory bar, and for players later into the game, they can get even more storage with the Expanding enchantment.
Developers should add backpacks, bags, belts, quivers. The inventory size can be larger, but the slot must hold less than 64 items.
Manatees could look like Sea Pigs
if this update happens maybe we could make ice tools and armor

This unironically has so much potential. They could make an ice class villager(easier ice farming), a freezer block that functions both as a workstation and to make ice blocks with water buckets, slabs, stairs, walls, chiseled, and polished blocks for every ice type, maybe ice panes(like glass), and recipes that use ice. They could also add tons of new stuff for snow and call it the "Snow and Ice Update."
Don't forget to improve the frozen biomes. We could have snow storms and maybe return the frozen desert biome by modifying it to be more useful.

I think this is a good idea and It would be really cool to optimize minecraft in general ESPECIALLY multiplayer beacause It can be very laggy but this small change that SteeperHydra637 propose it's great

Just a brief continuation, but I wanted to further develop the last point on the effects it would bring back. Making items that don't have many uses currently into potion ingredients is an easy way to make them feel more valuable. Some of the items I think would work for these missing effects are:

  • Ink Sac > Blindness (ink sac's 1 use currently is to be made into Black Dye. Keeping it as the organ for a potion recipe fits the theme of brewing nicely. As for mobs, their line of sight would be dropped to 0-2 blocks for the duration of the effect)
  • Rotten Flesh > Nausea (Rotten Flesh becomes useless the moment you have any other food and just takes up space. This at least takes the gross concept of ingesting flesh a comical context. When used on a mob, the mob will generally act dizzy and confused. Skeletons may miss their shots completely and creepers may accidentally explode.).
  • Bottle of Honey > Haste (Currently, Honey is only used as a food and a block ingredient. Making honey the key ingredient for Haste potions, mimicking being as busy as a bee, would make bee farms much more valuable. On mobs, this would increase their attack speed. With fermented spider eyes, this would become a mining fatigue potion, having the same effect on mobs.)

As for the ingredient I mentioned earlier in the post that would increase the duration the cream remains on the weapon, I think it should be Nether Quartz. On instantaneous effects, it would add an extra usage before disappearing.
coll idea i dont understand how this post has only 2 votes

And it would bring back some content to the game that used to keep plenty of players very entertained! You could have wacky, impossible, even diamond infested worlds! I really do hope they bring back this feature as it would go great with the caves and cliffs update!

Maybe, to make it not be too op, have each ink applied to a block only raise the brightness by 3 or 4 light levels, so you have to apply more in each block to make it actually glow brighter. That way, it won't replace torches or other light blocks, but would still be useful for builds.
It should drop the components to make the sea lantern, this approach is too OP

I was thinking the drop would be a glowing ink sac or something like that and it would be used like a dye , so that means you could put it on banners , wool , beds , carpet , maybe shulker boxes , maybe but probably not glass , and maybe leather armor . As for the glow I was thinking it would look whitish with a little blue and purple , I want to call the color fluorescent but I don't think that would be what I am thinking .

I think it should drop a glowing ink, 9 of which can be crafted into a glowing dye that can only be used to dye leather armor and banners, each dye = 3 light levels, at a Max of 4 dyes on a banner and 1 dye per armor. The banner could max at a 12 light level close to but not as good as a glowstone/sealight, and then the dyed leather armor would make it to you could be a moving light source, would help too much with spawns as they already don't spawn close but it could help with seeing in caves/the night without having to place torches

Yeah this is a great idea, we can escape from most of hostile mobs digging a hole or making a barricade. Since the warden is so powerful it must have the ability to break blocks. Of course only if he spotted you, it should break blocks in your direction...To balance things out, maybe we could use some strong noice to distract it or getting it stunned for some time, or maybe a silent potion!. It would be so thrilling and great!

For prevent block path to kill warden i have two suggestion:

Acid ability, the warden will split acid who turn block black like skulk and break like Frosted Ice giving time to player run or react.

Tongue, the warden will pull player just like fishing rod do.

I was actually going to post this. I had an idea on how it would work. So, stronger blocks would take longer to break than weaker blocks. Obsidian and netherite, for example, would take eight punches (I imagine the warden would do some kind of punching animation), blocks as strong as diamond and gold would take 6 punches, iron would take four punches, stone- strength blocks would take two punches, and anything weaker like dirt, wood, or sand would be easily punched through. Also, there could be an explosion, as if a powerful force hit the block, which could do further damage to any walls or dirt pillars unprepared players might try. This would allow late game players with a respectable amount of obsidian to more easily trap the warden behind a wall or even kill it by shooting it with arrows through a small hole, whereas an early game player or speedrunner would be punished hard for trying the iron golem trick with some dirt blocks on the warden, a late game mob.
Probably it will be in the game

completely agree, I always build walls first whenever I get a village and make it a castle... raids get too much ez like this because pillagers simply can't enter it form anywhere unless I open the gates. Ravagers should be able to break walls with 2-3 blocks thickness when they can't find a direct path to the village. This will of course require to better the pathfinding of ravagers and pillagers as well.
I think they should act like the siege weapon of pillagers, a gate/wall breaker. 
This will not only make the raids more interesting but also make players find new and creative ways of protecting the village and setting traps, as not everyone will have the patience to build 5 block thick walls (which would still be breakable after the cooldown of the ravager breach)
